alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Kobuk Valley; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 1:48PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Minor Coastal Flooding And Ice Push Possible Monday afternoon Into Tuesday... A strong storm now developing in the Western Bering Sea will move into the Central Chukchi Sea this afternoon, to north of Utqiagvik on Tuesday and then well north of Kaktovik on Wed. This storm will bring southerly winds of 40 to 50 mph to most of the West Coast today, with gusts 60 to 70 mph along Western Capes. This is expected to cause water levels along the coast to rise 3 to 5 feet from The YK Delta north to Kivalina today and tonight. This will likely cause water to flow on top of the sea ice and river ice near the coast, and could cause minor flooding of low lying areas near the coast. Another concern is that since sea ice fractured and pushed offshore in many area from the east winds of the past several days, that the south to southwest winds today and Tue could cause ice to push onshore (called an Ivu) in many areas, especially north of Scammon Bay along the coast to Shaktoolik. Flooding of infrastructure is not expected but people should move valuables to higher ground. People should be alert for water pushing on top of snow machine trails that run over ice or along the coast. People should be alert for ice pushing onto beach areas and the possibility that ice could push inland in some areas.
